title: Saudi Arabia’s Flynas Falls In IPO Debut Amid Conflict Jitters
content: Saudi Arabia’s Flynas Co. fell in its Riyadh trading debut on Wednesday as the escalating conflict between Israel and Iran reverberates across regional equity markets and pressures airline stocks.

title: European Gas Rises for Sixth Day With Hormuz Traffic in Focus
content: European natural gas prices extended gains for a sixth day, the longest streak in almost four weeks, as the conflict between Israel and Iran raises concerns over vessel traffic via the Strait of Hormuz, a key energy trade route.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 6/18/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Star Capital Weighs IPO of Defense Tech Firm Vincorion
content: Star Capital is considering an initial public offering of German defense technology firm Vincorion, people familiar with the matter said, as rising investor interest lifts the value in European aerospace and defense assets.

title: France Left Unloved by Investors as German Markets Power Ahead
content: In a year that’s all about Europe, there’s one key market missing out on all the investor love: France.

title: Horizons Middle East & Africa 06/18/2025
content: Horizons Middle East & Africa is your daily spotlight on one of the world's fastest-growing regions. Live from Dubai, we bring you the latest global markets and analysis, plus news-making interviews, with a special focus on MEA. All that and more, as you head to the office in the Gulf, pause for lunch in Hong Kong, or start your day in London or Johannesburg.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Total Says It Can Replace Russian Gas With Rising LNG Supply
content: TotalEnergies SE sees abundant alternatives to Russian gas as the European Union proposes a ban on all deliveries from the country by the end of 2027.

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 06/18/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Kamel: Trump Riding The Wave of Israel Campaign in Iran
content: US President Donald Trump met with his national security team in Washington on Tuesday to discuss the escalating Middle East conflict and any US involvement in the war between Israel and Iran.  Ayham Kamel, Edelman Public and Government Affairs Middle East President told Joumanna Bercetche on Horizons Middle East and Africa that the president is acting on the basis of his own convictions and examining political opportunities. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Blackstone-Backed Casino Operator Cirsa Announces IPO in Spain
content: Cirsa Enterprises, the casino operator owned by Blackstone Inc., announced plans for an initial public offering in Spain.

title: The World’s First Mass-Market Electric Car Gets a Facelift
content: Nissan Motor Co.’s push to breathe new life into its lineup will yield an updated version of the Leaf, the struggling brand’s compact family car that was the world’s first mass-market electric vehicle.

title: Mali to Control Loulo-Gounkoto Gold Mine for Six Months
content: Barrick Mining Corp.’s Loulo-Gounkoto gold mining complex should be placed under provisional administration for six months, handing control of one of the company’s biggest operations to state-appointed management, a Malian court ruled. Bloomberg’s William Clowes breaks down the situation.

title: KKR, GIC Are Among Final Bidders for MasOrange, Zegona  Joint Venture
content: KKR & Co. and GIC Pte. are among the final bidders for a stake in a fiber-optic broadband network venture owned by MasOrange and Zegona Communications Plc, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: PBOC Chief Envisions New World Currency Order After Dollar Era
content: People’s Bank of China Governor Pan Gongsheng laid out in the clearest terms yet his vision for the future of a new global currency order after decades of dollar dominance, predicting a more competitive system will take root in the years to come.

title: Oil Swings in Volatile Market as Trump Spurs War Escalation Fear
content: Oil fluctuated after rallying around 10% since Israel started its attacks on Iran last week, as speculation the US may join the conflict stoked concerns about supply disruptions in the Middle East.

title: Oil Near Five-Month High on Middle-East Tensions: Markets Wrap
content: Oil traded near a five-month high on concern escalating tensions in the Middle East will trigger more direct US involvement. Equities were mixed before a Federal Reserve monetary policy decision.

title: BSE Shares Fall as Options Expiry Day Shift Raises Earnings Risk
content: Shares of BSE Ltd. extended a five-day drop Wednesday after the bourse announced plans to switch its expiry day for equity derivatives contracts to Thursday, marking the latest shake-up in the world’s largest market for the contracts.

title: FTSE 100 Live: UK Inflation Higher Than Forecast in April
BBVA in Talks With Cerberus, One William Street on Loan Sales
content: BBVA SA is in advanced talks to sell two loan portfolios totaling around €650 million ($754 million) to funds including Cerberus Capital Management’s Spanish unit and One William Street Capital Fund, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: How China Is Building a Powerful Army of Hackers
content: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, how China’s domestic hacking competitions are helping boost the country’s cyber-espionage capabilities.

title: The Asia Trade: 6/18/2025
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Singapore and Sydney with Avril Hong and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: China’s Rare Earth Exports Slump in May as Magnet Sales Curbed
content: China’s exports of rare earth products — including powerful magnets now at the heart of tensions with the US — slumped to a fresh five-year low in May as Beijing’s export curbs choked flows.

title: Making Oil Gyrate Again, One Post at a Time
content: Raising the stakes to direct intervention and regime change is driving the price higher.

title: Goldman, JPMorgan Bet Strong Franc Will Shrug Off SNB Rate at 0%
content: Wall Street’s biggest banks are betting the Swiss franc’s strength and haven appeal will cope with the potential return of subzero interest rates in Europe.

title: China Will Hike Quota for Investors Buying Overseas Assets
content: China will allow some local investors to put more of their money into overseas assets, a sign Beijing is opening up its financial market as the yuan steadies.

title: Hedge Fund Traders Are Pushing Their Firms Into Dubai and Abu Dhabi
content: The rush of hedge funds heading to the UAE has been driven by the need to keep star traders happy. Escalating conflict in the region hasn’t deterred them so far.

title: EQT Founder Backs Startup Swebal With Plans to Build TNT Factory
content: Swedish defense startup Swebal has raised €3 million ($3.5 million) from investors including Thomas von Koch, the co-founder of private equity firm EQT AB, to help it construct a factory manufacturing the explosive material TNT.

title: Iron Ore Extends Downward Trend on Weaker Chinese Steel Market
content: Iron ore edged down for the fifth day, continuing a downward trajectory as China’s steel market weakens.

title: Energy CEOs Comment on Impact of Escalating Middle East Tensions
content: While speaking at a conference in Tokyo, the chief executives of Woodside Energy, JERA Co. and TotalEnergies commented on the impact of rising tensions in the Middle East on oil and gas markets.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: TotalEnergies Says It Can Replace Russian Gas With Growing LNG Supply
content: TotalEnergies SE sees abundant alternatives to Russian gas as the European Union proposes a ban on all deliveries from the country by the end of 2027. "The good news is that the LNG market will be well supplied from 2027, 2028 and 2029,” the company’s Chief Executive Officer Patrick Pouyanne says at an energy conference in Tokyo. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Israel Begins Repatriation of Citizens Stranded By Iran Strikes
content: Israel is repatriating tens of thousands of its citizens stranded abroad after a flare-up in fighting with Iran, deploying emergency airlifts and ferries.

title: Thai Cabinet Rift Over Key Post Risks Shaking Ruling Bloc
content: Thailand’s ruling party and its top coalition partner are clashing over a key ministerial post, as a looming cabinet shakeup by Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra threatens to shift alliances and unsettle the conservative establishment.

title: India’s Goyal to Visit UK to Discuss Trade Deal Implementation
content: India’s Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal will visit the United Kingdom on June 18 to discuss the progress on the implementation of the trade deal announced last month.

title: Indonesia to Summon BI Deputy as Witness in Graft Case: Technoz
content: Indonesia’s anti graft agency has sent a letter summoning Bank Indonesia Deputy Governor Filianingsih Hendarta for questioning as a witness in a graft case related to a social program, local news outlet Technoz reported on Wednesday.

title: Pakistan’s Army Chief Set to Meet Trump Amid Iran Tensions
content: President Donald Trump is expected to meet Pakistan’s army chief for talks as the US considers supporting Israeli airstrikes on Iran — a partner of the government in Islamabad.

title: Israel-Iran Conflict Enters Sixth Day as Trump Weighs Options
content: Iran and Israel exchanged fire for a sixth day after US President Donald Trump met with his national security team to discuss the escalating conflict, fueling fresh speculation that Washington is on the verge of joining the attacks.

title: Modi Pushes Back Against Trump’s Claim on Pakistan Ceasefire
content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi disputed President Donald Trump’s claims that trade deals were used to clinch a ceasefire with Pakistan during last month’s military conflict.

title: A UK Wealth Exodus? Why ‘Non-Dom’ Crackdown Risks Backfiring for Reeves
content: The debate over the UK’s “non-dom” status has taken center stage yet again. The decision by Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves to end a two-century old tax break for wealthy foreigners has triggered the exit of many well-heeled residents from the country.

title: Once-Mighty Hezbollah Stays Out of Iran’s War Against Israel
content: One of Israel’s most feared scenarios has long been that Iran would unleash an attack on it in coordination with its powerful network of proxy militias.

title: US-China Tech Fight Widens After Taiwan Blacklists Huawei
content: Taiwan joined a yearslong US campaign to curtail China’s technological ascent when it blacklisted the country’s AI and chipmaking champions, an unprecedented step that may signal a resurgent effort to isolate its powerful neighbor’s semiconductor sector.

title: Trump Flexes Security Powers to Keep Global Tariff Goal Alive
content: The Trump administration is pressing ahead with another tariff barrage that some trade experts say is more legally sound than the president’s country-by-country duties and may end up having an equally broad effect on imports.

title: China Consumer Rush for Subsidies Overloads Stimulus Program
content: China is testing the limits of what its consumer stimulus can accomplish by subsidizing purchases of select goods, fueling a shopping spree that boosted retail sales growth to the strongest in more than a year but threatening to overwhelm authorities even in the richest regions.

title: US Lawmakers’ Talks With Top Taiwan Official Risk Irking China
content: A group of US lawmakers held a rare publicly disclosed meeting with Taiwan’s top defense official, a discussion that risks spurring China to step up its military intimidation of the democracy.

title: Canada, India Agree to Name New Ambassadors After Expulsions
content: Canada and India agreed to appoint new chief diplomats in a major step toward moving past a feud that last year saw them expel each other’s officials over accusations of transnational repression and crime.

title: Japan to Protect Trade Interests And Not Rush Deal, Ishiba Says
content: Japan will prioritize protecting its national interests in trade talks without rushing into a deal with the US, Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said as he wrapped up two days of meetings at the Group of Seven gathering.

title: Putin Aide Shoigu Meets Kim as Pyongyang Plans More Military Aid
content: Kim Jong Un discussed ongoing cooperation with Moscow in talks with President Vladimir Putin’s top security aide Sergei Shoigu, North Korea’s state media said Wednesday, after reports that Pyongyang plans to send more military personnel to support Russia.

title: Australian PM Says EU Trade Deal Is ‘Symbolically Important’
content: Expanding trade ties between Australia and the European Union would be “symbolically important” in an environment of rising protectionism, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said Wednesday, as the two sides also plan talks on a defense agreement.

title: Petro Seizes Colombia Labor Reform Victory, Worrying Businesses
content: The Colombian Senate approved one of President Gustavo Petro’s key reforms to boost workers’ benefits, creating concerns among businesses that it would raise labor costs.

title: Stefanik Asks SEC to Investigate Harvard Bond Offering
content: Representative Elise Stefanik called on the US Securities and Exchange Commission to investigate Harvard University’s recent bond sale, alleging the school may have withheld material information from investors about its standoff with the federal government.

title: Warren Slams Hegseth Decision to Slash Pentagon Weapons Testing Office
content: A Pentagon plan to slash staffing at its weapons testing office threatens the safety and effectiveness of every weapons program it oversees and “will cost service members’ lives and waste taxpayer dollars,” Senator Elizabeth Warren said.

title: Meloni Pushes for Gaza Ceasefire at G-7 Amid Israel-Iran Crisis
content: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni sought to rally the Group of Seven leaders to support a ceasefire in Gaza, renewing the push amid an escalation of hostilities between Iran and Israel.

title: Colombia High Court Returns Petro’s Pension Bill to Congress
content: Colombia’s Constitutional Court returned the government-backed pension reform to Congress, citing a procedural error in a move that offers a glimmer of hope for President Gustavo Petro, whose ambitious social reforms have faced significant hurdles in the legislature.

title: Trump Weighs Iran Options as Israel Ratchets Up Airstrikes
content: President Donald Trump met with his national security team in Washington for more than an hour on Tuesday to discuss the escalating Middle East conflict, according to people familiar with the matter, fueling fresh speculation that the US is on the verge of joining Israel’s attack on Iran.

title: G-7 Confronts New Reality After Trump Spoils Hopes for Unity
content: On Sunday evening, Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney took to a comfy sofa to chew the fat over glasses of wine with European Group of Seven leaders at their hotel bar in Kananaskis, the Rocky Mountain resort hosting this year’s summit.

title: US Embassy in Jerusalem to Close for Three Days as Tensions Rise
content: The US Embassy in Jerusalem will remain closed for the next three days, the State Department said, as speculation grows that the Trump administration may be on the verge of joining Israel’s attack against Iran.

title: Key Takeaways From Summit of G-7 Leaders in Canada
content: Below are the key takeaways from our blog coverage of the Group of Seven leaders’ summit in Kananaskis, Canada. For more, click here for our TOPLive blog.

title: Senate Passes Stablecoin Bill in Win for Crypto, Trump
content: The US Senate passed stablecoin legislation setting up regulatory rules for cryptocurrencies pegged to the dollar, in a landmark win for the ascendant crypto industry and President Donald Trump.

title: Viasat Identified as Victim in Sweeping Phone Hack Tied to China
content: Viasat Inc. is the latest US communications company identified as a victim of the sweeping surveillance hack blamed on the Chinese government that emerged during last year’s presidential campaign, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Iran-Israel Conflict Spills to Digital World, Inflaming Rivalry
content: The conflict between Israel and Iran is spilling over into the digital world, inflaming a decades-long campaign of hacks and espionage between two nations renowned for their cyber prowess.

title: Trump Again Pushes TikTok Sale Deadline With 90-Day Extension
content: President Donald Trump is extending for a third time the deadline for Chinese company ByteDance Ltd. to divest the American operations of TikTok, allowing the social media app to keep running in the US while negotiations proceed.

title: Trump Weighing Options for Iran as Israeli Airstrikes Continue
content: Good morning. Markets await more details on the Israel-Iran plan after Donald Trump met with his national security team. London’s sky-high rents are pushing even flat-sharers out of the market. And hedge funds are rushing to Dubai and Abu Dhabi. Listen to the day’s top stories.

title: India’s Top Developer’s New $1.3 Billion Luxury Project Sells Out in One Week
content: India’s biggest real estate developer sold luxury residences worth about 110 billion rupees ($1.3 billion) at a new highrise project near capital New Delhi, as demand for lavish homes shows no sign of abating.

title: EU Proposes Using Unspent Covid Funds for Defense
content: Welcome to the Brussels Edition, Bloomberg’s daily briefing on what matters most in the heart of the European Union.The EU is rushing to get its European Defence Industry Programme, or EDIP, over the line before leaders meet in Brussels at the end of June. The instrument will serve as a vehicle for the bloc’s future defense funding. While seemingly small with just €1.5 billion from the EU budget for 2025-2027, it may grow rapidly. title: Airbus Targets Higher Dividend Payments, Affirms 2025 Guidance
content: Airbus SE said it would target higher dividend payments, raising the upper range of its payout to shareholders, as earnings remain resilient despite uncertainty from tariffs and supply chain snags that have slowed down deliveries of its aircraft to customers.

content: The rush of hedge funds heading to the UAE has been driven by the need to keep star traders happy. Escalating conflict in the region hasn’t deterred them so far.

content: Asian food titan Wilmar International Ltd.’s shares plunged to their lowest level in more than five years, after the company said several units in Indonesia were pressed to hand over 11.9 trillion rupiah ($729 million) as a security deposit ahead of a court ruling on a 2022 palm oil export case.

content: Sirens sounded across Tel Aviv early Wednesday morning as air defense systems intercepted projectiles that were fired at Israel. (Source: Bloomberg)

content: KKR & Co. and GIC Pte. are among the final bidders for a stake in a fiber-optic broadband network venture owned by MasOrange and Zegona Communications Plc, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: How China Is Building a Powerful Army of Hackers
content: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, how China’s domestic hacking competitions are helping boost the country’s cyber-espionage capabilities.

title: JD.com Billionaire Unveils Turnaround Plan After Five-Year Slump
content: JD.com Inc. founder Richard Liu vowed to speed an overseas foray and compete with Meituan in new arenas from food delivery to travel, describing his boldest attempt yet to revive an online retailer that’s languished since a 2020 government crackdown.

title: US-China Tech Fight Widens After Taiwan Blacklists Huawei
content: Taiwan joined a yearslong US campaign to curtail China’s technological ascent when it blacklisted the country’s AI and chipmaking champions, an unprecedented step that may signal a resurgent effort to isolate its powerful neighbor’s semiconductor sector.

title: Nintendo Extends Gains to Record on Booming Sales of Switch 2
content: Nintendo Co. shares rallied the most in two months to a fresh record as investors increased their focus on the firm’s strong sales growth as a shelter from global volatility.

title: AI Startup Anysphere Fields VC Offers at Over $18 Billion Valuation
content: Silicon Valley investors are anxious to back the startup they say is the fastest growing of all time.

title: Altman Says Meta Offered OpenAI Staffers $100 Million Bonuses
content: OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman said Meta Platforms Inc. has offered his employees signing bonuses as high as $100 million, with even larger annual compensation packages, as it seeks to build a top artificial intelligence team.

title: Iran-Israel Conflict Spills to Digital World, Inflaming Rivalry
content: The conflict between Israel and Iran is spilling over into the digital world, inflaming a decades-long campaign of hacks and espionage between two nations renowned for their cyber prowess.

title: Trump Again Pushes TikTok Sale Deadline With 90-Day Extension
content: President Donald Trump is extending for a third time the deadline for Chinese company ByteDance Ltd. to divest the American operations of TikTok, allowing the social media app to keep running in the US while negotiations proceed.

title: Chip Tax Credits Get Boost in Trump Tax Bill | Bloomberg Tech 6/17/2025
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss how President Trump’s tax bill could boost investment credit for semiconductors to 30%. Plus, the CEO of Applied Intuition talks about how the startup plans to use its latest $600 million fundraising to make more moving machines self-driving. And the CEO of Purism says the company has spoken to the Trump family about supplying its made-in-the-USA smartphones to the new Trump mobile phone service. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Musk’s xAI Burns Through $1 Billion a Month as Costs Pile Up
content: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup xAI is burning through $1 billion a month as the cost of building its advanced AI models races ahead of the limited revenues, according to people briefed on the company’s financials.

title: JPMorgan to Pilot Deposit Token JPMD on Coinbase-Linked Blockchain
content: JPMorgan Chase & Co. will launch a pilot for a token called JPMD that represents dollar deposits at the world’s biggest bank, as financial institutions deepen their push into the digital-asset sector.

title: Amazon’s Jassy Says AI Will Reduce Company’s Corporate Ranks
content: Amazon.com Inc. Chief Executive Officer Andy Jassy says he expects the company’s workforce to decline in the next few years as the retail and cloud-computing giant uses artificial intelligence to handle more tasks.

title: A Lithium Startup Is Building a US Battery Plant That Will Skirt Trump’s Tariffs
content: US startup Pure Lithium Corp. is working on a testing facility to build a new type of lithium battery that’s completely manufactured domestically.

title: Musk’s X Sues New York Over Law Requiring Hate-Speech Data
content: Elon Musk’s X Corp. sued the state of New York claiming a law requiring social media companies to disclose how they deal with hate speech, extremism and disinformation violates the US Constitution.

title: Revolut Will Soon Launch Its AI Financial Assistant, UK CEO Says
content: Revolut will be launching its AI financial assistant soon, according to one of the fintech’s top executives.

title: Adobe Debuts Standalone App for Generating AI Videos, Images
content: Adobe Inc. on Tuesday released a standalone Firefly mobile application for Android and iOS in an attempt to put a larger spotlight on its artificial intelligence-powered image generation and editing tools.

title: Meta Just Bet Big Bucks on AI Talent
content: Mark Zuckerberg’s investment in Scale AI and its founder, Alexandr Wang, shows how AI startups have become farm teams for the big-spending giants, explains Bloomberg Opinion columnist Dave Lee. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: SoftBank Sells T-Mobile Stake for $4.8 Billion to Bet on AI
content: SoftBank Group Corp. raised around $4.8 billion through a sale of T-Mobile US Inc. shares, a move that helps fund the Japanese company’s grandiose plans for artificial intelligence.

title: Musk’s xAI in Talks to Raise $4.3 Billion in Equity Funding
content: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup xAI is in talks to raise $4.3 billion through an equity investment on top of the $5 billion it has recently been trying to borrow from debt investors, according to information the company shared with investors who asked not to be identified because it is private.

title: Salesforce Increases Prices as it Promotes New AI Features
content: Salesforce Inc. is increasing the price for many products, becoming the latest software maker to adjust its cost structure as it integrates artificial intelligence.

title: 23andMe Fined £2.31 Million by UK Over Genetic Data Leak
content: 23andMe was fined £2.31 million ($3.1 million) by UK regulators after a 2023 cyber attack exposed users’ genetic data in yet another privacy crisis surrounding the troubled DNA data bank.

title: Oracle’s $116 Billion Surge Leaves Little Room for Error on AI
content: Oracle Corp. investors find themselves at a pivotal crossroads. Either heed the warning from a growing list of indicators that suggest the stock has run up too far, too fast — or continue to chase another rally that’s been supercharged by lofty artificial intelligence expectations.

title: Applied Intuition Hits $15 Billion Valuation for AI Vehicle Tech
content: The company raised $600 million from investors as it prepares for an eventual IPO.

title: Ramp Investors Add Funding as Company Expands, Plans AI Agents
content: Spend-management platform Ramp gave existing investors an opportunity to double down on the six-year-old upstart with a recently closed $200 million funding round that boosted the company’s valuation to $16 billion.

title: Tiny Startup Brings Homegrown AI to Mongolia, Avoiding China-US Dominance
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Saritha Rai looks at an AI startup in tiny Mongolia and its surprising development of a homegrown large language model.

title: China’s MiniMax Says Its New AI Reasoning Model Beats DeepSeek
content: Chinese AI upstart MiniMax released a new large language model, joining a slew of domestic peers inspired to surpass DeepSeek in the field of reasoning AI.

title: Thiel-Backed Fund Invests in Ex-Citi Banker’s Stablecoin Startup
content: A startup run by two-decade Citigroup Inc. veteran Tony McLaughlin raised $10 million from investors including Peter Thiel’s Founders Fund to address an issue it says is holding back adoption of stablecoins.

title: Meta Testing New Auto-Generated Video Ads as Part of AI Push
content: Meta Platforms Inc., the owner of Facebook and Instagram, is pushing deeper into AI-generated advertisements in a bid to make it cheaper and simpler for marketers to craft their messages.

title: UK Inflation Holds at Highest in Over a Year Before BOE Vote
content: UK inflation remained at its highest in over a year, keeping price pressures uncomfortably strong as the Bank of England weighs how much energy market turmoil will affect its path to cutting interest rates.

title: China Car Subsidy Halted in Some Areas as Funds Run Low
content: China’s trade-in subsidy to boost sales of electric and fuel-efficient vehicles has been suspended in key cities across at least six provinces as funds run short and officials scrutinize the prevalence of ‘zero-mileage’ used cars.

title: Nomura Says US to Set High Asia Tariffs to Stop China Rerouting
content: The US may keep elevated tariffs on Southeast Asian countries amid data suggesting that China is diverting goods through the region to avoid higher levies, according to Nomura Holdings Inc.

title: Indonesia to Summon BI Deputy as Witness in Graft Case: Technoz
content: Indonesia’s anti graft agency has sent a letter summoning Bank Indonesia Deputy Governor Filianingsih Hendarta for questioning as a witness in a graft case related to a social program, local news outlet Technoz reported on Wednesday.

title: PBOC Chief Envisions New World Currency Order After Dollar Era
content: People’s Bank of China Governor Pan Gongsheng laid out in the clearest terms yet his vision for the future of a new global currency order after decades of dollar dominance, predicting a more competitive system will take root in the years to come.

title: Thai Exports Soar Most in Three Years as Tariff Talks Begin
content: Thailand’s exports surged the most since early 2022 as companies rushed to stockpile goods while the Trump administration’s planned tariffs are still on hold.

title: Modi Pushes Back Against Trump’s Claim on Pakistan Ceasefire
content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi disputed President Donald Trump’s claims that trade deals were used to clinch a ceasefire with Pakistan during last month’s military conflict.

title: Goldman, JPMorgan Bet Strong Franc Will Shrug Off SNB Rate at 0%
content: Wall Street’s biggest banks are betting the Swiss franc’s strength and haven appeal will cope with the potential return of subzero interest rates in Europe.

title: London’s Sky-High Prices Thin the Ranks of Room-to-Rent Seekers
content: The number of people looking for a room to rent in London has continued to slide, data from a property search website show, in a sign that high rents are pushing even that modest goal out of reach for many residents.

title: BOK Warns of Inflation Risks From US Tariffs, Israel-Iran Crisis
content: While South Korea’s inflation has stabilized near the central bank’s 2% target, US tariffs and the Israel-Iran conflict are adding uncertainty to the outlook, according to the Bank of Korea.

title: Japan to Protect Trade Interests And Not Rush Deal, Ishiba Says
content: Japan will prioritize protecting its national interests in trade talks without rushing into a deal with the US, Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said as he wrapped up two days of meetings at the Group of Seven gathering.

title: Australian PM Says EU Trade Deal Is ‘Symbolically Important’
content: Expanding trade ties between Australia and the European Union would be “symbolically important” in an environment of rising protectionism, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said Wednesday, as the two sides also plan talks on a defense agreement.

title: Japan, South Korea Pledge Closer Ties After Lee-Ishiba Meeting
content: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung and Japan’s Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba agreed to step up cooperation in their first in-person talks, in an early indication of the direction of future relations between the two countries after Lee took office.

title: Japan’s Exports Drop Raises Recession Risks as US Tariffs Bite
content: Japan’s exports fell for the first time in eight months as the US tariff campaign weighed on global trade, raising the risk of a technical recession after the economy contracted at the start of the year.

title: Biggest Free Food Program Hobbled by India’s Dated Census Data
content: The government relies on old figures to shape budgets and policies.

title: Chile Holds Rates at 5%, Leaving Timing Open on Future Cuts
content: Chile’s central bank kept its interest rate unchanged and signaled it will resume cuts in coming months as long as the economic impact from global uncertainty — including the Middle East conflict — remains limited.

title: Fed to Hold Rates Steady Again as Officials Wait for More Clarity on Economy
content: Federal Reserve officials are widely expected to leave interest rates unchanged for a fourth straight meeting on Wednesday, reiterating they want more clarity on the economic impact of a wide array of government policy changes before adjusting borrowing costs.

title: New Zealand Plans Switch to Annual Data-Driven Census From 2030
content: New Zealand will drop its five-yearly census and adopt a new approach using administrative data collected across a range of government agencies from 2030.

title: Milei Cools Argentina Wholesale Inflation to Lowest Since 2020
content: Argentine President Javier Milei notched another economic victory Tuesday after data showed wholesale prices declined in May for the first time since the height of the pandemic, adding to his momentum before October midterm elections.

title: Supreme Court Asked to Hear Challenge to Trump’s Global Tariffs
content: Two family-owned toy companies are asking the US Supreme Court to consider striking down many of President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs, putting a high-stakes fight with worldwide economic implications before the justices for the first time.

title: Harder to Cut With Core Inflation Firm, Bank of Canada Says
content: Bank of Canada officials said it would be tough to cut the policy interest rate further if core inflation remains firm, but acknowledged more easing may be needed if the economy continues to weaken.

title: Tax Bill Lacks Votes as Senate Aims for SALT, Medicaid Deals
content: Republican leaders are aiming for quick negotiations over needed changes to the newly unveiled Senate tax bill which lacks the votes to secure majorities in both chambers as written.

title: G-7 Leaders Won't Reach Agreement on Ukraine Statement
content: World leaders meet during the Group of Seven (G7) Summit at the Pomeroy Kananaskis Mountain Lodge in Kananaskis, Alberta, Canada on June 17, 2025.

title: Europe Pitches Stability to Bond Investors Wary of US Turbulence
content: Finance officials from across Europe are touting their bond markets as a haven from US volatility in a bid to attract global investors rethinking their dollar allocations.

title: IMF Met With Emerging-Market Creditors on Debt Rework Strategies
content: A group of International Monetary Fund officials met private creditors last week in London, as part of the multilateral lender’s work to publish a new report on sovereign debt restructurings in emerging markets, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: ECB Should Watch Oil Price, Euro in Setting Rates, Villeroy Says
content: The European Central Bank needs to assess fluctuations in oil prices and the euro as it sets borrowing costs, according to Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau.

title: Nassim Taleb Says Trump’s Approach to Tariffs ‘Makes No Sense’
content: The Black Swan author Nassim Taleb said President Donald Trump’s approach to tariffs will depress US gross domestic product and could soon lead to labor shortages.

title: US Homebuilder Sentiment Drops to Lowest Level Since End of 2022
content: Confidence among US homebuilders fell in June to the lowest level since December 2022, with potential buyers deterred by high mortgage rates and anxiety about tariffs and the economy.

title: US Retail Sales Drop for Second Month as Tariff Anxiety Sets In
content: US retail sales fell for a second straight month in May, suggesting anxiety over tariffs and personal finances prompted consumers to pull back after an early-year spending rush.

title: Ireland Removes Pay Caps for AIB and PTSB Executives
content: Salary caps for executives at AIB Group Plc and Permanent TSB Group Plc will be removed, Ireland’s Minister for Finance Paschal Donohoe said.

title: Germany’s Defense Firms Need Steelmakers to Help Fuel Boom
content: German defense manufacturers including Rheinmetall AG are urging domestic steelmakers to ramp up production of military-grade metal, to secure their long-term ability to make armored trucks and tanks.

title: German Property Lender PBB Leaves US, Issues Profit Warning
content: German property lender Deutsche Pfandbriefbank AG said it will pull out of the US and may report a full-year loss as a result.

title: China Car Subsidy Halted in Some Areas as Funds Run Low
content: China’s trade-in subsidy to boost sales of electric and fuel-efficient vehicles has been suspended in key cities across at least six provinces as funds run short and officials scrutinize the prevalence of ‘zero-mileage’ used cars.

title: Renault Kicks Off CEO Search After De Meo’s Surprise Exit
content: Renault SA is under pressure to quickly find a replacement for Chief Executive Officer Luca de Meo after the shock news of his planned departure, as the industry grapples with rising trade tensions and intense competition from Chinese manufacturers led by BYD Co.

title: Panthers Beat Oilers 5-1 to Become Repeat Stanley Cup Champion
content: SUNRISE, Fla. (AP) — Stanley's stay in South Florida is getting extended.

title: Dozens of Bali Flights Canceled After Volcanic Eruption
content: Indonesia’s Bali airport saw dozens of flights canceled because of a volcanic eruption nearby, stranding holidaymakers and threatening the area’s key tourism industry.

title: London’s Sky-High Prices Thin the Ranks of Room-to-Rent Seekers
content: The number of people looking for a room to rent in London has continued to slide, data from a property search website show, in a sign that high rents are pushing even that modest goal out of reach for many residents.

title: Mitsubishi Motors Raises US Prices as Tariffs Roil Carmakers
content: Mitsubishi Motors Corp. is raising US prices for some vehicle models as the industry grapples with the fallout of President Donald Trump’s tariffs on imported cars and parts.

title: Germany Risks Higher Power Prices If Green Goals Are Cut: Study
content: Germany would see significantly higher electricity prices if it backtracks from its renewable energy expansion targets than if the government keeps pursuing them, think tank Agora Energiewende said.

title: Hong Kong Supply Chain Company Li & Fung Weighs Bond Offering
content: Hong Kong-based Li & Fung Ltd. is considering a potential bond offering and has held meetings with investors to gauge interest, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Cargill Cuts Vietnam Aquafeed Business in Global Restructuring
content: Cargill Inc. is exiting its aquaculture feed business in Vietnam, following a broader restructuring at the world’s largest agricultural commodities trader.

title: Caris Life Sciences IPO Prices Above Range to Raise $494 Million
content: Caris Life Sciences Inc., a health-care company that uses technology to help diagnose and treat cancer, raised $494 million in a US initial public offering that priced above the top of its marketed range.

title: US Plans to Ease Capital Rule Limiting Banks’ Treasury Trades
content: The top US bank regulators plan to reduce a key capital buffer by up to 1.5 percentage points for the biggest lenders after concerns that it constrained their trading in the $29 trillion Treasuries market.

title: Tanking China Coking Coal Market Gets Respite After Output Halts
content: Chinese coking coal futures have staged a rare recovery this month, with the latest gains driven by temporary halts to production in the mining hub of Shanxi as regulators conduct environmental assessments.

title: UK Expects Improved Buffer for Electricity Supplies This Winter
content: The UK’s power grid is expecting to have a bigger buffer to guard against potential shortages this winter, reducing the need for backup supplies to help keep the lights on.

title: General Mills Is Latest Packaged-Food Company to Remove Dyes
content: Packaged-food maker General Mills Inc. is joining Kraft Heinz Co. in removing synthetic food dyes from its US products by the end of 2027 — a move that will eliminate ingredients such as Red 40 and Yellow 5 from its brightly colored cereals.

title: Perelman at $410 Million Art Trial Says Fire Faded His Works
content: Ron Perelman told a judge that five of his paintings totaling over $400 million in value lost their luster from a fire in his Hamptons home, at the trial of his lawsuit seeking to force his insurers to cover the cost.

title: Nuclear-Powered Cargo Ships Promise Cleaner, Faster Transport
content: Military vessels have relied on atomic energy for decades, but now commercial shipbuilders are attempting to tap the technology.

title: Morgan Stanley’s Top Asia Banker Targets $10 Billion in Revenue
content: Last month, as the US-China trade war heated up, Morgan Stanley’s co-President Dan Simkowitz made a discreet visit to Beijing. It was the first time a senior US executive from the bank had stepped foot in China in five years, and came days after a rare board meeting in Tokyo near the Imperial Palace.

title: General Mills to Remove Artificial Dyes, Star Tribune Reports
content: General Mills Inc., the maker of Lucky Charms and Trix cereals, will remove synthetic dyes from its products by the end of 2027, according to the Minnesota Star Tribune.

title: EDPR to Shift Focus Within Asia to ‘High-Growth Markets’
content: EDP Renewables SA is shifting its focus within Asia-Pacific toward “high-growth markets” such as Japan, Australia and Taiwan, a spokesperson said in a statement.

title: Canada Business Group Pushes for Pipeline Expansion in Mexico
content: Canadian companies could help Mexico reduce its lopsided dependency on imported US natural gas by maximizing its own domestic supplies of the fuel, according to the head of Canada’s top business group.

title: UnitedHealth Cuts Some Medicare Advantage Plan Commissions
content: UnitedHealth Group Inc. is cutting commissions for brokers on some Medicare Advantage plans, according to documents reviewed by Bloomberg News, a move that appears designed to discourage agents from selling those plans.

title: Clothing Retailer Dynamite Raises Prices 9% Amid Trade Tensions
content: Women’s fast-fashion retailer Groupe Dynamite Inc. raised prices by 9% over the past year and plans to increase them at twice the rate of inflation for the foreseeable future, its chief executive officer said. Shares on Tuesday rose by the most since the company went public last year after it reported strong first-quarter results, including higher revenue.

title: FDA Announces New Vouchers to Cut Drug Reviews to Two Months
content: The US Food and Drug Administration announced a new national priority voucher plan that aims to cut drug review times to one to two months for companies it says are backing national interests.

title: Revolut Will Soon Launch Its AI Financial Assistant, UK CEO Says
content: Revolut will be launching its AI financial assistant soon, according to one of the fintech’s top executives.

title: New NASA Boss May Not Take Over Until Next Year, Acting Head Says
content: NASA might be without a new administrator until early 2026, according to the acting head of the agency, casting doubts on the direction of the US space program after President Donald Trump last month pulled the nomination of Elon Musk’s ally, Jared Isaacman.

title: India Regulator Finds No Major Safety Issues With Air India 787s
content: India’s aviation safety regulator found no major safety concerns with Air India’s fleet of Boeing Co. 787 jets during ongoing inspections following a crash last week that killed 241 passengers and crew.

title: Americans Pull Back From Restaurants by Most Since 2023
content: Spending at restaurants and bars slumped in May by the most in more than two years, underscoring how tariffs and geopolitical tensions are making consumers nervous about their finances.

title: Boeing Plans No Further Changes to Global Services After Revamp
content: Boeing Co. has completed restructuring its Global Services business and isn’t planning to make deeper cuts once it divests its Jeppesen unit later this year, the division’s chief executive officer said.

title: Here Are The Fintech Companies That Could Go Public In 2025

title: Fintech Funding Holds Strong As Airwallex Lands $300M

title: Proofpoint To Buy Hornetsecurity For Around $1B

title: Venture Capital’s Second(ary) Chance
content: The lack of a healthy exit market is an existential problem for the venture capital industry, writes guest author Dan Gray, who sees the evolving strategy of secondary markets as one solution.

title: DFJ Growth Closes $1.2B Flagship Fund

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: AI Autonomous Agents Are Top 2025 Trend For Seed Investment
content: Earlier this week, we wrote about investment trends popping up at seed stage. However, we left out one area where funding activity was so voluminous it warranted its own dedicated piece. Unsurprisingly, it is about AI.

title: What Seed Trends Say About The Future: Live Long, Recycle And Launch More Satellites
content: After plowing through a huge pile of seed funding rounds, we identified four areas where seed is trending this year: longevity, defense, waste reduction and spacetech. Here's where a lot of that investment is going.

title: A Deep Dive Into The Leading Investors In Unicorns Minted Since 2023
content: Since 2023, 259 new unicorns have joined The Crunchbase Unicorn Board, adding $605 billion in total value and altogether raising $130 billion, Crunchbase data shows. We take a look at who's leading new investments.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Trump weighs potential U.S. military strike on Iran, demands ‘unconditional surrender’
